subject: IP'm late
body:
I'm late ....so what ! I When I first came to New York I spent more time than that looking for a rooming house that had no cats. dogs, or monkeys, I found two of three - enjoyed the ride and considered myself lucky to be accident free bewildered and broke.
 
My Avalon deserves a story of its own -so that will wait until later.
You are in the Capitol ,of the WORLD ENJOY and give my regards to Jasmine.

subject: ON THE ROAD AGAIN...WILLIE NELSON
body:
SAM


DIDN'T KNOW if u had changed your e-mail, but not so according to your dad...

where you are headed is more beautiful than you can imagine, at least  that's my opinion. Kind of throws you, because you are not expecting the surreal beauty, quality, especially nightfall.

I only glimpsed, YOU will explore and I know you will enjoy.



(Grandmother) Elsa

had some wonderful Norwegian genes (she)enjoyed the outdoors and nature.

Indeed I think there is a sprinkling of nature genes in all of us. Its nice  to have

some natural beauty right in your background as well as your backyard.


You come from a generation of explorers, if you count your father's exploration

crawling, running, jumping and testing the limits of both his physical ability and my patience. We all did O.K. at/in Yosemite...a weekly Friday night jaunt from Dublin to a tent site, almost every Friday night of summer. 

DUBLIN, California that is..!!!


Remind me to tell you about Dublin, Ireland on Friday nights in 50s. especially

Rathmines.


your father was also a aspiring fisherman, a work in progress but was limited since I knew nothing   about fishing or cared to...


I'm looking forward to seeing some photo shots when you get back...


Until then enough said...Good Luck, May God guide you...


Enjoy your venture

Grandpa Bart.











































































































































































thrt















































































































































































































































 vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvu

subject: forgetfulness is not a character trait
body:
SAM
Just found an E-mail addressed to you, but am at a loss how it uploaded on to me...forget my lost memory and remember the
present...I am out and a-b-o-u-t ...cautiously.
love
Grampy-Gimpy

subject: Re: a reequest for a meeting and a ride in my AVCAL;ON
body:
Hi Grandpa,

Sorry for the late reply. We just got to NYC today for all of June, but
I’ll be back in early July and look forward to seeing you again then!

Love,
Sam

On Wed, May 31, 2023 at 21:00 <blackbart711@comcast.net> wrote:

> Sam    please keep this a secret
> Quiet please, let's make this E-MaiL one that flies under the RADAR
> but accomplishes its purpose.
> How about you and Jasmine pick me up at BROOKSBY where you can transport
> me to my  STORAGE AREA where I wiLl need  3-4 hours rummaging around to
> find some items for my 2room apartment...Its
> only a 10minute ride to AMERICAN STORAGE FROMb  OkSBY
>
--

subject: an apology and better times ahead
body:
Sam

It isn't too often a Grandpa says to his Grandson
...forgive my surliness... referring to Saturday's outing, but sometimes things  do not play out as planned and  there are mishaps///
Saturday was such a day and I know your   father meant well and I didn't want to disappoint...either of you, though I knew better...

having said my piece I rest my case.

Good luck on whatever road you choose

As they say in Ireland the 'craic' must go on...Long live the Republic

Grandpa.

to: Mark Casey <mcasey65@verizon.net>, Brian Casey <bcasey@daymarksi.com>, Neil Casey <ncasey33@gmail.com>, Sam Casey <Scasey5@babson.edu>

subject: TRYING TO COPY BRADY
body:
SAM

I've said my piece on a much larger scale (check your dad's E-mails) so I don't want to overdue it, you might get so

excited that you show up at the white house, during a Press conference.



SAM


 its great to be able to congratulate you on YOUR

WIN, but M.V.P....now that's really worth noting.


The  opportunity to say CONGRATULATIONS, is only the

             BEGINNING of many more  WINS and  MVP'S I WISH FOR YOU...SINCERELY

LOVE

GRANDPA BART.

subject: sorry it took so long.
body:
Emil...Sam 

Sorry it took so long to say Thank you for the 'sliotar' I am having a great time banging it around with my 'caman' 
So far I have only smashed two windows...my aim is not quite as good as it used to be............!!... 

I know you are looking forward to your summer vacation...hope it is everything you planned for.... 
Grandpa Bart.

subject: a promise
body:
Your DAD agreed/promised me that he would escort me to a camera outlet (shop) this week...please remember my notification so that I can take photo\\s of my surroundings...
...and...his promise   TAKE ME TO CAMERA OUTLET T ...................................................................By the way ...YOU might be interested in some PANOGRAAPHS OF MY   TRAVELS...ALSO A SITTING DOWN VARIANCE.
 
travelAITs...why don't we share some time together and I can let you handle (with clean hands...of course) you can use my basin to soften and pre-cloot your fingrs.
sO THE WORD IS...WHEN IS BART GOING TO GET HIS CAMERA....
TONITE THE (TUESDAY) AT BEST BUY
 
 
                    RIG'HT ON MC,DUFF
                          BART

subject: Re: Happy Father’s Day!
body:

Tim e to get started, since    it seems like a long time since I closed my eyes and now it is abut time for  "MAIL CALL" 11:10P.M.
Time marches on and so do we...now that is a' deep though't...supposedly used by the 'rite wing' when identifying 'fake' news..
and so I meander along...observing...as you repeat (almost) the same message....

g'0Night
DAD.
,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              \\

subject: Re: Checking in
body:
Hi Sam,

thanks for the email. i am sure you are planning some sort of party for the 4th but i hope its not an insurrection of some sort!  have fun. see you when I am out of this place.

Grandpa

>

> 
>     Happy to hear you went home today. How are you doing?
>

subject: Fwd: A MEAL FIT FOR A KING
body:
Thanks for hosting Grandpa on Easter.  He enjoyed it as u can see. :)

Sent from my iPhone
617 947 0709

Begin forwarded message:

From: blackbart711@comcast.net<mailto:blackbart711@comcast.net>
Date: April 16, 2017 at 9:18:04 PM EDT
To: Brian Casey <bcasey@daymarksi.com<mailto:bcasey@daymarksi.com>>
Subject: A MEAL FIT FOR A KING
Reply-To: blackbart711@comcast.net<mailto:blackbart711@comcast.net>


Brian

to Wendy and Emily and you and the dogs I almost forgot SAM a sincere THANK YOU....The PIE was delicious Emily was delightful

and instructable (she will know) and helpful too...Wendy ThankYou.

SAM expending and expanding his  wish that graduation does not come  too  soon...Its  All a bunch of CREEDASTRAW right Brian!!!

Granpa, Dad, Bart.

subject: the last E-mail
body:
SAM
I just got a  look at my E-mail to you...please forgive my 'screw-up'
your Dad will be able to (explain) sort it out...
(sometimes I 'fade 'out or succumb to the sleep virus).. do not confuse with 'coronavirus'
AND                                            

l will act responsibly and tell you "I fell asleep on the job"

does that mean "I AM FIRED"

your response  might  make my day
Grandpa Bart.

subject: BEST WISHES FOR A GREAT, WONDERFUL SAFE GAME
body:
SAM

Good Luck,,. and May the Luck of the Irish follow you.. (You or your Mom will have to give me the 'equivalency' for  May the Luck﻿ of the Irish/// in Hebrew ala ENGLISH.

All joking aside...I'm wishing for you a GREAT (even settle for good)DAY.



Speaking of Rugby I lived and shared a bedroom with 3 others...2 University students (Medicine)and the other occupant was a Engineer. the MED students played Rugby...so I got an intro to it but so long ago it fails me.


Never been an athlete... a farmer's son, had neither time allotted or a place to practice, so until HURLING COMES ALONG I will  follow you and WAVE..


such was life in DUBLIN the late 40s/ early 50s... maybe a POUND between all 3 of us'very limited CRAIC...

THE ENGINEER HADN'T MUCH MORE...and he was fully employed...construction. Enuf for now...

Regards and Good Luck to your MA and PA

Please have your father decipher this I cannot do CUT and PASTE

and I really screwed up...and its getting late

Again Best of luck TOMORROW. 

Grandpa Bart.

subject: a short trip...enjoy
body:
listen up Brian...

Make sure you show significant skills and show that in this game of hitting a small ball into a small hole twilight///autumn of life that you can more than hold your head  high when it comes to the game of goofgolf. HOW ELSE CAN I FEEL THE P[RIDE where  in a town that fell short on Sport you was 

PRIDE UPON THE FIELDS OF TOPSFIELD as I remember with quiet pride my  part of driver to and sometime twoand fr o in the DODGE

of our DODGE  (registered under THE CLEAN AIR ACT AS A BUSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSDGDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD          ) TO EFFECT YOUR DEDICATED EFFORTS...

at being Topsfield's first dedicated GOLFER  WHO BROU HGT, fame and recognition to THE NORT SHORE O

BOSTON .

sleep is foring me to direct my                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  toughts and praaaaaaaayers for a nice                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         g'nite mates


LOVE

DAD
